required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of a Latest Dural Substitute
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multi-center, Randomized, Parallel-controlled Clinical Trial Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Lyoplant Onlay in Repairing Cerebral Dura Mater

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective, multi-center, randomized, parallel-controlled clinical trial was designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Lyoplant Onlay in repairing cerebral dura mater. DURAFORM was regarded as the control group. a total of 80 patients were randomized into experimental and control group (1:1).Data were collected on complications resulting in CSF leaks, surgical site infections, instrument performance parameterized other neurological complications within 30 days. Surgeons also provided data on the ease of use of the dural sealing techniques, as well as preparation and application times. The above-mentioned date were used to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Lyoplant Onlay .

primary_outcome.description: proportion of treated patients free of CSF leak diagnosed by physical examination, biochemical assay, or imaging study within 30 d of the surgical procedure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 days post surgery/10 days post surgery/at 30 days post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of intracranial infection at 2 days after operation，at discharge，and at 30 days after operation

arm_group.description: DURAFORM was used in repairing cerebral dura mater.
Lyoplant Onlay was used in repairing cerebral dura mater.

intervention.description: Lyoplant Onlay is a kind of latest artificial Dura Mater
DURAFORM is a kind of conventional artificial Dura Mater

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any patient between the ages of 18 and 75 years scheduled for elective cranial surgery involving a dural incision.
- Dural defects and surgical incision was classifed as level 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- local or systemic infection.
- patients with known allergy to Equipment components
- a history of traumatic head injury
- a compromised immune system or autoimmune disease
- patients who should not participate based on the surgeon's opinion
- patients participating in any other drug or device trial.
- expected survival time <12 months
- underwent chemoradiotherapy 3 months before randomization
- uncontrolled diabetes and malignant tumor
- women who were pregnant, lactating, or wished to become pregnant during the study;

patient_data.ipd_description: The committee will debate whether to share IPD depending on the circumstances. Because some patients are unwilling to make their condition known.
